channel.title: R on Big Data Time
channel.description: Recent content in R on Big Data Time

item.title: How to reset R environment | 如何清理R的工作环境
item.description: As part of best practice, cleaning the R environment before running the code is suggested. The following code will remove all variables and unload all libraries. 作为最佳实践的一部分，在运行R的程序之前建议首先重置R的工作环境。下面的程序会清空R的所有变量以及程序库。 # Clear environment of variables and functions rm(list = ls(all = TRUE)) # Clear environmet of packages if(is.null(sessionInfo()$otherPkgs) == FALSE)lapply(paste("package:", names(sessionInfo()$otherPkgs), sep=""), detach, character.only = TRUE, unload = TRUE)

item.title: How to count NULLs with SQL and R
item.description: When representing no values, NULL and NA are used in SQL and R, respectively. Be careful that NULL in R is not the same one as NULL in SQL. Using SQL select count(*) [Number of Null Salaries] from EmP where Salary is NULL Using base R # load the data into dataframe install.packages("RODBC") library(RODBC) conn <- odbcConnect("localhost") Emp <- sqlQuery(conn,"select * from capstone.dbo.Emp") numNAs <- apply(is.
